Gather Supplies Sort broken crayons into piles. Group all like colored crayons together to determine how many you will have of each color. Remove crayon labels (if they are still wrapped in paper). Search for empty film canisters, prescription bottles or glue sticks. You will melting the crayons into one of these containers so look for something you can use as a mold. Wash out the canister, bottle or glue stick container thoroughly. Once the wax melts inside the cupcake tin you will pour the wax into your mold and allow it time to set before use. Create Multi-Layered Crayons Place grouped colored crayons inside individual oven safe cups. Don’t overfill, but allow crayons to fill tins about 2/3 of the way. Re-break crayon pieces if they are too long to accommodate the tin dimensions. Turn oven to 250 degrees and place one tin in the oven. Bake for approximately 10 to 15 minutes, checking often. You want the wax to melt but not boil or bubble. Remove tin from the oven (using oven mitts) and transfer immediately to the waiting mold. Don’t forget to spray the inside of the mold with cooking spray (lightly) so crayons slide out easily. Place funnel over mold and pour the first layer of melted wax. Fill as high as you’d like (take into consideration you will be adding more wax along the way) and continue filling other molds until finished. Allow wax/crayon to cool before adding the next color (using the same method). Let it harden for several minutes. Remove the wax/crayon out of the container by using a safety pin to ease it out of it. Try it out.
